column5: I have been watching and our group is a little concerned. We are leaving in 10 days, and were just wondering if there were any road closures or detours, mainly on 11 or 71 in Ontario. Thanks for your input/help

I've lost the bubble on the specifics, but there was one in the vicinity of Northern Lights Lake last week, one north of Thunder Bay, and one down near the Minnesota border at the west edge of Boundary Waters/Quetico. If the following link works, it should take to the Ontario MNR page with the latest fire information. There's a link on the left for current situation. http://affm.mnr.gov.on.ca/spectrasit...m/affmhome.cfm The one below takes you directly to a maps page.http://affm.mnr.gov.on.ca/spectrasit...89EB4D71018E93

Hopefully fires are slowing down after some rain this weekend. The fire ban was lifted in some areas, and roads re-opened. I've included the link to the MNR Forest Fire Management site - all updated info can be found therehttp://affm.mnr.gov.on.ca/spectrasit.../affm/fire.cfm Jessica North Waters Bait & Tackle Kakabeka Falls, ON
Thank you for your information. I appreciate it. I'm like a little kid the night before Christmas.
Excellent link. Thanks. What do you mean "like" the night before Christmas? I thought it "was". :-)
>Excellent link. Thanks. What do you mean "like" the night >before Christmas? I thought it "was". :-) You are absolutely correct. I AM the little kid. I can't sleep and we still have 8 days.

>>Excellent link. Thanks. What do you mean "like" the night >>before Christmas? I thought it "was". :-) > > > >You are absolutely correct. I AM the little kid. I can't >sleep and we still have 8 days. Kind of like that Disney commercial where the grown up says "I can't sleep cause I'm too excited". It will be a sleepless 3 weeks for me.

Hi there, We have gotten so much rain , you might consider wearing your lifejackets when driving up here. just kidding, the fire situation is remaining low, so it looks good for the next couple of weeks.
